lead_paragraph: 6:38 p.m. | Updated The former finance chief for the convicted swindler Bernard L. Madoff was released on $10 million bail on Tuesday, months after he admitted his role in an enormous Ponzi scheme that cost thousands of investors billions of dollars and agreed to cooperate with prosecutors, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: Former Aide to Madoff Is Freed on $10 Million Bail
